# criteria.maximin { #pyLHD.criteria.maximin }

`criteria.maximin(arr)`

Compute the maximin criterion for a given design. A higher value corresponds to a more regular scattering of design points.

## Parameters

| Name   | Type          | Description     | Default    |
|--------|---------------|-----------------|------------|
| `arr`  | npt.ArrayLike | A numpy ndarray | _required_ |

## Returns

| Type   | Description                  |
|--------|------------------------------|
| float  | Calculated maximin criterion |

## Examples



```{python}
import pyLHD
random_lhd = pyLHD.LatinHypercube(size = (10,3))
pyLHD.maximin(random_lhd)
```
